verses.roman:
śrī-śuka uvāca
ekaikaśas tāḥ kṛṣṇasya
putrān daśa-daśābaāḥ
ajījanann anavamān
pituḥ sarvātma-sampadā

synonyms: śrī-śukaḥ uvāca—Śrī Śukadeva Gosvāmī said; eka-ekaśaḥ—each one of them; tāḥ—they; kṛṣṇasya—of Lord Kṛṣṇa; putrān—sons; daśa-daśa—ten each; abalāḥ—the wives; ajījanan—gave birth to; anavamān—not inferior; sarva—in all; ātma—His personal; sampadā—opulences.
translation: Śukadeva Gosvāmī said: Each of Lord Kṛṣṇa's wives gave birth to ten sons, who were not less than their father, having all His personal opulence.

purport.content: Lord Kṛṣṇa had 16,108 wives, and thus this verse indicates that the Lord begot 161,080 sons.
